content:
The docs on future-incompatibilities reports say to specify an --id ID option to this command, but don't explain what it's for. The cli help just says "identifier of the report generated by a Cargo command invocation". If I try to run the command (with or without an ID), I get:

error: no reports are currently available
I guess it gives you an id when a future incompat issue happens for the current build.
Do you get a warning about a future incompatibility?

The intended workflow is you run a build and cargo reports a short warning from one of your dependencies with an ID.
Then you call reports with that ID and it gives you a longform report about the particular issue cargo came across during your build.
I see, so the implied context of the docs are that you've already seen a warning from cargo. I was trying to write a summary of the feature for the release blog post.
The point of the feature is so that rustc can move the ecosystem off functionality/bugs that they intend to remove.
If it still being used by unmaintained or older versions of crates, this lets the warning show up for the people who are using those crates.
Got it, thanks for the help and summary!
